page.title: 07Two Authors and Their Legacy
page.content:
{William Barnes}was a local poet, famous for his poems written in traditional Dorset dialect. Barnes was the rector of Came Church near Came House. He is buried in the little churchyard of Came Church. In the church visitors book, there are records of people who still come here from all parts of Britain especially to see where Barnes is buried, and to see where he worked.
{Thomas Hardy}is famous for his poems and stories. He built a house called Max Gate just East of Dorchester. Tourists from as far away as the U.S.A and Japan come on 'pilgrimages' to Dorchester to see where he lived and worked.In his novels Dorchester is referred to as Casterbridge and the public house 'The Trumpet Major' is named after one of his books.
